inclusion.criterion: Documentation of localization-related epilepsy based on clinical, neuropsychological and imaging criteria
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Failure of seizures to respond to adequate therapy with at least two standard antiepileptic drugs
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Willingness to be considered for surgery
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Fluency in English. Non-native speakers may be included if their fluency is equivalent to that of a native speaker.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Willingness to participate in and complete the study
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Right-handedness assessed by the Edinburg handedness inventory
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Contra-indications to MRI studies (such as pacemakers, cochlear devices, surgical clips etc. metallic implants, orthopedic pins, shrapnel, permanent eyeliner, vagus nerve stimulator)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Claustrophobia or anxiety disorders exacerbated by the MRI scanner
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: People with neurological or psychiatric disease or taking medications that would affect fMRI and MEG language studies
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Pregnancy. All females of child bearing potential must have a negative test prior to MRI scanning
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients on phenobarbital or chronic benzodiazepines
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Contra-indications MRI studies (metallic implants, recent orthopedic pins, cochlear implants, surgical clips, cardiac pacemakers and defibrillation devices, shrapnel, permanent eyeliner, vagus nerve stimulator)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Any medical condition or chronic medication that might affect fMRI or MEG language activation by affecting cerebral structure or function, such as diabetes, hypertension, antihypertensive medications, psychotropic agents.
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Pregnancy. All females of child bearing potential must have a negative test prior to MRI scanning
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: 62-year-old African-American man with left upper and lower extremity weakness, associated with dark visual spot in right eye, right facial numbness, facial drop and slurred speech. Hypertension, hyperlipidemia and hypothyroidism. Smokes cigarette 1 pack per day for 40 years and alcohol consumption of 5 to 6 beers per week.
